par.text: Helium is the second most abundant element in the universe, after hydrogen, constituting about 25% of the mass of the universe (28% of the sun). Helium content in the Earth's crust is found to be 8 ·
%, and the element ranks 71st in abundance. Trace amounts of helium are present in the upper part of the atmosphere. Helium is a product of the radioactive decay of elements found in rocks.
